alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 4:12PM CDT until June 06 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Bureau County in north central Illinois... Putnam County in north central Illinois... * Until 1015 PM CDT Monday. * At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hennepin, McNabb, Putnam, Magnolia, Milo, Lake Thunderbird, Lone Tree Corners and Florid. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
